translated: Birth Stories

analyzed: catukka nipāta  pu ci manda vagga
translated: The Four-Collection🔽The Chapter with Pucimanda
The Birth Story of the Gift of All Flesh
“Harsh indeed are your words,
you who beg for flesh;
Your words are like a knife,
I give you a knife, my friend.”
“This is a part of humans,
called a brother in the world;
Your words are like a part,
I give you a part, my friend.”
“When a son says ‘Father,’
it shakes the father’s heart;
Your words are like a heart,
I give you a heart, my friend.”
“In a village where there is no friend,
it is just like the wilderness;
Your words are like all,
I give you all, my friend.”
The Birth Story of the Gift of All Flesh, the fifth.
